Detailed Description

This class represents a two-dimensional vector.

Many functions are provided that allow modification of Vector2Ds; however, none of them alter the specific instance (instead returning new Vector2D instances that you can assign to variables). Equality and inequality operators are provided; though they do a fuzzy match and so cost more than you might otherwise expect.

Member Function Documentation

def vector2d.Vector2D.__new__ (   cls,
  first,
  second = None 
)

Instantiate a Vector2D.

We accept either two coordinates, or a single argument which is assumed to be a tuple or list with at least two elements.

Property Documentation

vector2d.Vector2D.x = property(_getX_) [static]

Clean-looking way of accessing the first element.

This is marginally slower than using [0] but makes for easier-to-read code.

vector2d.Vector2D.y = property(_getY_) [static]

As x property, for second element.
